title.narrative: OUTPUT 1 : [ACCES TO EDUCATION]

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, educational structures offer equitable and inclusive learning opportunities and formal and non-formal education to 550,000 out-of-school girls and boys - including the most marginalized and those affected by the humanitarian crisis., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Equitable Access to Quality Basic Education]: By the end of 2019, the barriers to school attendance for children aged 3â€“15, particularly girls and the most disadvantaged children, have been lifted and children are able to access quality basic education and succeed at school.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, educational structures offer equitable and inclusive learning opportunities and formal and non-formal educationto 550,000 out-of-school girls and boys - including the most marginalized and those affected by the humanitarian crisis.

description.narrative: UNICEF facilitated the access of vulnerable children to quality basic education, including in humanitarian contexts. In 2019, 277,237 children (49 per cent girls) children were enrolled and maintained in schools, while 204,471 (49 per cent girls) out of school children (OOSC) accessed formal schooling, , including 96,045 (48 per cent girls) in humanitarian settings. In 2019, another key achievement was the implementation of a platform in the regions of Sikasso, Koulikoro, Kayes, Segou and Bamako to monitor the enrollment and retention of OOSC into formal schooling. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/02/2020
